msContents.summary: The Vasudhāradhāraṇī, dedicated to Vasudhārā, the bodhisattva of wealth, prosperity, and abundance (who has a strong following among the Newar Buddhists of the Kathmandu valley), is taught by the Buddha in Kauśāmbī to the rich merchant and layman Sucandra. He has been reduced to poverty and so requests a sermon from the Lord so that he may provide for his own family and so that all beings may become prosperous. This scripture includes a dhāraṇī along with enumerations of benefits and ritual instructions for use. This palm-leaf manuscript is probably to be dated to the 13-14th century CE. Its original wood cover are beautifully illuminated, although the illustartions are somewhat damaged.

msItem.title: Vasudhārādhāraṇī
Vasudhāraṇī
Vasudhārādhāraṇīsūtra
msItem.incipit:
[2r1] kalpoditena vidhinā paripaśyamānā yā dhārayā vividharatnasuvarṇṇamayyā | pūrṇṇaṃ karoti bha[1v2]vanaṃ sahasaiva sarvaṃ tāṃ sarvalokajananīm praṇamā%mi bhaktyā || tvan devi sarvaguṇaratnamayānidhānālokārthakāryadhanadhānyasamṛ[1v3]ddhihetoḥ | hārārddhahāramakuṭamaṇikalpavṛ¦%kṣam trailokanāthavasudhārasudhāranāmā || utsṛṣṭarogabhayamṛtyum anekado[1v4]ṣān_ dāridraduḥkhavraṇarohaṇam oṣadhīnī % || saubhāgyarūpaguṇapuṣkalagotravarṇṇa sarvan dadāti tava pādayugan namā[1v5]mi | yām amy aguruvidhitaḥ paripathyamā%nā lakṣmīn dadāti vipulāṃ sugatopabhogāṃ | tān vāraṇīṃ sakalasatvahitai[1v6]kavittāṃ bhaktyā namāmi satataṃ vasudhārasaṃ%jñā | yā saṃsmṛtāsuvirasucchutarapravṛddhan dāridraduḥkhaduritaṃ śamate [2r1] narāṇāṃ tāṅ kalpavṛkṣasaṭṭaśīm vasudhārasaṃ¦%jñām bhaktyā namāmi śirasā jagato hitāya || @ ||
evam mayā śrutam eka[2r2]smin_ samaye bhagavān_ kośāmbyā mahānagaryā%m viharati sma | kaṇṭakasaṃjñake mahāvanavare yoṣilārāme mahatā bhikṣusa[2r3]ghena sārdham pañcamātrair bhikṣuśataiḥ sabahulaiś ca¦% mahāśrāvakair asaṃkhyeyaiś ca bodhisatvair mmahāsatvaiḥ sarvabuddhaguṇasamanvāgatai¦[2r4]ḥ |
[2r5] tena khalu punaḥ sa%mayena kausāmbyamahānagaryāṃ sucandro nāma gṛhapatiḥ prativasati sma |
msItem.explicit: [16v2] idam avocad bhagavāttamanā āyuṣmān ānandas te ca bhi[16v3]kṣavas te ca bodhisatvāḥ sā ca sarvāvatī parṣat sadeva%mānuṣāsuragandharvaś ca loko bhagavato bhāṣitam abhyanandan iti || @ ||
msItem.colophon: [16v4] ye % dharmā hetuprabhāvā hetun teṣān tathāgato hy avadat teṣāñ ca yo nirodha evaṃvādī ma[16v5]hāśra,anaḥ || @ ||

supportDesc.condition: Complete, generally in good condition, but brittle and worm-eaten, with somewhat damaged margins.

layout.p: 6 lines per page, approximately 45 akṣaras per line.
layout.stringHole: One string hole, in the left part of the folio. It is approximately in the middle of 2.5 cm-wide blank space.
layout.p: The written area is divided into two sections, the left one narrower (ca. 9 cm) than the right one (ca. 15.5 cm.), divided by a blank space for the string hole

list.item: On folio 1 recto, two lines in Nepālākṣarā by a different hand: [1r1] -2- rūpalāyaḥ sadā panarmmya bhavanaś cāṣiri??guṇadoṣa | ??yorthitaḥ prātamuḥ svagṛhe ṣavarthuḥ kṛtvā kaniśi??khannamanavā-3-[1r2] sabdajanābhijrānātidābhe stu ka??te%ghoresmasānagahanabhapabherave ca . ?ādanti?/spadhisi asinaś ca||

decoNote.desc:
Both the inner covers bear polichrome miniatures.
On the inner side of the front cover, a representation of Vasudhārā, flanked by two attendents .
On the inner side of the back cover, three vignettes:
1. The representation of a punishment in a Bddhist hell
2. The Buddha is given the gift of honey by two worshiping monkeys
3. Illustrations of birds, flying humanoid figures and a four-leged animal (very damaged and of difficult identification)

history.provenance:
Bought in Nepāl by Prof. C. Bendall Bendall, Cecil
in 1884-5.
